subject: RE: [junit] client-server simulation in separate JVM's using Junit
msgSnippet: Hi, ... You might search the net for commercial testing tools. IIRC there is one which can distribute junit tests across multiple VMs. I do not remember ist
messageBody:
Hi,

> I have a need to spawn a server and multiple clients in
> different VM's

You might search the net for commercial testing tools. IIRC there is one
which can distribute junit tests across multiple VMs. I do not remember ist
name.

Bernd


> because of singleton use of a library that each client uses which
> limits me to this solution. Server starts, then clients each start
> and interact with the server and make assertions on the response from
> server.
>
>
> I know about Ant with parallel task or batch job. I know about
> ActiveTestSuite and JUnitPref but they seems to run tests in
> different
> threads but same JVM.
>
> I'd like to do this from ONE TestCase since that seems like a nicer
> solution than Ant parallel task. e.g my TestClientServer
> would spawn
> a server in a different VM and also spawn as many clients as I want
> each in its own VM and then once all client(s) test methods are done,
> the TestClientServer tears down.
>
>
> Is there a way to do this.
>
>
> thanks
>
